hedline: Anonymous call to British paper, threats to US President: 5 things JFK files reveal
para: US President Donald Trump on Thursday ordered the unveiling of 2,800 documents related to the 1963 assassination of President John F Kennedy.

hedline: Politics in the age of Modi is a 24X7 exercise. Is Rahul really up to the challenge?
para: The Congress needs a major surgery overhauling its local units, and needs a fresh narrative rather than simply expect Narendra Modi to self-destruct

hedline: Abdul Karim Telgi, the rise and fall of India’s stamp paper scam kingpin
para: The counterfeit stamp paper scam is estimated to have dealt the Indian economy a Rs 32,000-crore blow. Telgi was the main accused in the racket.

hedline: Ten things to know about Neom, Saudi Arabia’s proposed $500 billion mega-city
para: A trailer for the proposed mega-city shows women running in crop tops, robots and clean energy.

hedline: ‘I wonder who they voted for’: Indians facing identity crisis in US under Trump
para: Despite support within neighbourhoods, the sense of being different and standing out from the crowd has heightened for Indian students since Trump assumed office.

hedline: Greater Noida attacks: Are Indians racist towards African nationals? Web poll
para: The attacks on ‘Nigerian’ students in Greater Noida over the past two days appear to confirm an ugly truth about Indian society.

hedline: Is Tata Motors-VW-Skoda partnership a win-win of the underdogs?
para: Tata Motors and Volkswagen entered a technological partnership to make economy segment cars under Skoda Auto. So who needed the deal more – Tata or Volkswagen? Who will be affected more?

hedline: Thugs of Hindostan? Aamir Khan dons ‘thug’ look for magazine cover
para: Aamir Khan features on the cover of Filmfare magazine. This is the birthday special issue for Aamir as he turns 52 on March 14. Sporting a long beard and moustache, the PK star’s swag is unmissable.

hedline: The health of Indian children is improving but there is still a long way to go
para: There has been an improvement in almost all childhood health indicators but India still has to go a long way to match the healthcare facilities of other nations, reveals the data of The National Family Health Survey 2015-16.

hedline: Ramjas protests, Gurmehar’s posts: Hey, celebs and netas, leave them kids alone
para: Many politicians and celebrities have commented on the incidents of violence in DU’s Ramjas  College and the FB posts of Gurmehar Kaur, the daughter of an Indian Army soldier who died in anti-militancy ops inJ-K in 1999.

hedline: Ramjas protests, Gurmehar’s posts: Hey, celebs and netas, leave them kids alone
para: Many politicians and celebrities have commented on the incidents of violence in DU’s Ramjas  College and the FB posts of Gurmehar Kaur, the daughter of an Indian Army soldier who died in anti-militancy ops inJ-K in 1999.

hedline: With pastures for cattle shrinking, India may have to import milk by 2021
para: India may have to import milk in four years, if it cannot increase fodder supply for its 299 million cattle, as rising pressure on land reduces pastures nationwide.

hedline: Carlos Ghosn: The man of many cultures who drove Nissan into India
para: Carlos Ghosn, the man who drove Nissan into India, stepped down as the Japanese automaker’s chief executive on February 23. Will his stepping down as the man behind Nissan affect Nissan’s India story?

hedline: Sasikala’s MLAs: ‘Locked up’ in luxury, ‘without’ their freedom
para: More than a hundred AIADMK legislators corralled into a leisure retreat to stop them from running away to the rival camp are in the lap of luxury — swimming, sauna, massage and fine dining at a floating restaurant. The only luxury they are not allowed...

hedline: From the heartland: Firozabad, hope and typhoid in UP’s city of bangles
para: Ahead of Uttar Pradesh election, Shashi Shekhar takes you to Firozabad, the town famed for its colourful bangles, now another victim of unfulfilled poll promises.
